programme.title: Chelsea vs. Liverpool - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: After their 3-1 win in May, Chelsea could enjoy back-to-back league wins over Liverpool for the first time since November 2014. Liverpool are winless in their last four Premier League games at Stamford Bridge and could lose away to Chelsea two seasons running in the league for the first time since losing three on the bounce from 2004-05 to 2006-07.

programme.title: Main Race - F1 Singapore Grand Prix - 2025
programme.desc: beIN SPORTS is the live and exclusive broadcast partners of Formula 1 until end of 2033 season. The 2025 season has a record schedule of 24 Formula 1 races and all race weekends, including every Practice, Qualifying, Sprint and Race will be live and exclusive on beIN.

programme.title: Brentford vs. Manchester City - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Since completing a Premier League double over Manchester City in 2022-23, Brentford are winless in their last four against the Citizens in the division. Manchester City have only lost one of their four Premier League visits to Brentford, going down 1-0 on the final day of the 2022-23 season.

programme.title: Leeds United vs. Tottenham Hotspur - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Leeds United have lost nine of their last 11 Premier League games against Tottenham Hotspur, including each of their last four in a row – their longest ever league losing run to Spurs. Tottenham have won both of their last two league visits to Elland Road and could beat Leeds United away from home three times running in the league for the very first time.

programme.title: PALESTINE, ONE JERSEY, MANY ROOTS
programme.desc: Story of the Palestinian national football team, a team that is far more than the sum of its players. Separated by borders, by checkpoints, and exile, the tells is inspiring “One Jersey…Many Roots” them is a single jersey, a shared dream, and a deep sense of responsibility to players come from every corner of Palestine and from communities scattered across the globe. What unites represent their people on and off the pitch that Palestine endures. This is not just in every match, they carry not just a ball but the weight of history, identity and hope. Fot their supporters, each goal is a voice, each victory a declaration. Football it s a living emblem of unity, resilience and the unbreakable b

programme.title: PSG vs Strasbourg - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: Paris Saint-Germain are unbeaten in their 34 home games against Strasbourg in Ligue 1, the most home games by a team against another without losing in the history of the top-flight. Paris Saint-Germain have won three Ligue 1 matches by two or more goals this season, the joint-most with Marseille, though they have only done so fewer times after seven Ligue 1 matches in two previous seasons under QSI ownership.

programme.desc: Arsenal have lost both of their last two home league games against West Ham, only ever losing three in a row once before. programme.title: Everton vs Crystal Palace - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: Everton have lost just one of their last 21 Premier League meetings with Crystal Palace, a 1-3 defeat in December 2021. Indeed, among all sides they have faced 20+ times in the competition, their points-per-game rate of 1.81 against the Eagles is bettered only against West Brom. Crystal Palace are winless in each of their last 10 Premier League away games against Everton since a 3-2 victory in September 2014 under Neil Warnock.

programme.title: Newcastle United vs Nottingham Forest - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: Newcastle United have won six of their last seven league meetings with Nottingham Forest, including their last three in a row since a 1-3 defeat in December 2023. The Magpies last won more in succession over the Tricky Trees in March 1937. Nottingham Forest have lost eight of their last nine league visits to Newcastle United, conceding 24 goals in this period.

programme.title: Huddersfield Town vs Bolton Wanderers - EFL - English Football League SkyBet - League One 2025/2026
programme.desc: Live and exclusive action from the EFL (English Football League) One. EFL One is the third-tier in the English football league system. At the end of each season three teams are promoted to the EFL Championship and the four clubs that finished at the bottom of EFL League One are relegated to EFL League Two. The season runs from 8 August 2025 until 2 May 2026.

programme.desc: This will be the first time Sanfrecce Hiroshima and Shanghai Port face off in the AFC Champions League Elite; Sanfrecce Hiroshima have won just two of their 10 games against opponents from China in the competition, with a win in their most recent such game. programme.title: FC Seoul (KOR) vs Buriram United (THA) -AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - East MD2
programme.desc: FC Seoul are unbeaten in each of their four meetings against Buriram United in the AFC Champions League Elite, including wins in each of their last two; in fact, FC Seoul have lost just one of their six meetings against Thai sides in the competition, with the loss coming in their most recent such game. programme.title: PFC Nasaf (UZB) vs Al Hilal SFC (KSA) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - West MD2
programme.desc: This will be the first fixture in AFC Champions League Elite between Nasaf and Al-Hilal, Nasaf have won just one of their eight games against teams from Saudi Arabia in the competition and are winless in their last four such games. Al-Hilal have lost just one of their 14 group stage games against teams from Uzbekistan in AFC Champions League Elite history, a 1-2 loss to FK Mash’al Mubarek in 2006; they have scored in each of their 14 such games in the competition, scoring at least twice in 11 of these.

programme.title: Al Gharafa SC (QAT) vs Al Shorta (IRQ) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - West MD2
programme.desc: This will be the first meeting between Al Gharafa and Al Shorta in the AFC Champions League Elite; Al Gharafa is winless in their two encounters against Iraqi sides in the competition while Al Shorta is unbeaten in their last two games against Qatari sides. Al Gharafa won their most recent home game in the AFC Champions League Elite, the last time they won back-to-back home games in the competition was a run of three games between May 2012 and April 2013; they kept a clean sheet in their previous home game, they have never recorded back-to-back clean sheets at home in the competition.

programme.title: Race 1 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: The Misano weekend opens with a sprint that rewards clean starts, tyre warm-up and bravery through Curvone. Expect late dives into Turn 1, heavy braking at Quercia and traction duels out of Tramonto onto the back straight. Safety cars and track-limits calls can flip the order, while newcomers hunt points and title hopefuls set the tone for the round.

programme.title: Race 2 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: Race 2 reshuffles the deck after overnight tweaks. Warmer track temps raise tyre-degradation stakes, making slipstream timing on the main straight vital. Inside lines at Turn 1 and measured exits from Tramonto decide most passes. Watch for undercuts on out-laps, safety-car restarts, and penalties for track limits as contenders bank crucial mid-round points.

programme.title: Race 3 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: With setups refined, Race 3 is often the weekend’s fiercest sprint. Nose-to-tail packs form into Turn 1, while rhythm and patience through the fast right-lefts keep front tyres alive. Curvone commitment and a tidy run to Quercia create overtaking chances. Expect bold moves, defensive elbows, and strategy on push laps to climb

programme.title: Race 4 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: The Misano finale. Championship hopefuls chase maximum points as fatigue, tyre life and track limits shape the last attacks. A strong launch, disciplined braking at Quercia and perfect traction from Tramonto decide podiums. Anticipate safety-car drama, photo-finish drafts to the stripe, and decisive moves under pressure as the round closes with a flat-out sprint.

programme.title: Race 5 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: Rising talents go wheel-to-wheel at Misano World Circuit Marco Simoncelli in Race 5. Slipstreams on the main straight and commitment through Curvone shape the order, while track limits, safety cars, and bold restarts can flip everything late. A flat-out sprint where newcomers and title hopefuls fight to the flag.

programme.title: Race - Qiddiya Round - Extreme H World Cup 2025
Race - Qiddiya Round - Extreme H World Cup 2025
Race - Qiddiya Round - Extreme H World Cup 2025
programme.desc: Extreme H World Cup hits Qiddiya for a desert race. Hydrogen-powered Pioneer 25 SUVs face Time Trials, head-to-head heats, and a multi-car Grand Final, with energy management, tyre wear and route choice deciding positions. Expect dunes, dust and daring passes under the Tuwaiq cliffs, driver switches, and strategy on boost usage as teams chase points, manufacturer bragging rights and momentum in the sport’s new zero-emissions era. Broadcast highlights and on-board shots bring the action home.

programme.title: My Faith in Sport - Sawm
programme.desc: Ramadan is a crucial period in the Islamic calendar but fasting (Sawm) can provide complications for athletes who are trying to compete at the highest level. But to what extent is fasting a negative or can it actually aid performance? We look at the life and adaptation throughout Ramadan of Adam Azim – an unbeaten professional boxer from the UK, Fares El Bakh – a weightlifter who won Qatar’s first ever Olympic gold medal, and Zainab Alema – a rugby player who is aiming to become the first player to represent England wearing a hijab. Experts in Sports Science and Nutrition from Aspetar Clinic, Qatar also add detail of the physical impact athletes encounter during Ramadan.

programme.title: Tomas Martin ETCHEVERRY (ARG) vs Miomir KECMANOVIC (SRB) - ATP 250 - BNP Paribas Nordic Open - Stock
programme.desc: Stockholm (13–19 Oct). Indoor hard at Kungliga Tennishallen. Draws: 28 singles / 16 doubles. Prize money: €706,850. Expect fast, first-strike tennis — big serves, sharp returns, and tight tie-breaks. Home favorites and rising talents push for autumn ranking points and a Sunday trophy.

programme.desc: The 2025 FIFA U-20 World Cup will be held in Chile from 27 September to 19 October 2025. The Tournament features 24 National Teams from 6 confederations.All the games are live and exclusive only on beIN.

programme.title: Nîmes vs Nantes - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germains 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.title: HL - World series Triathlon - Dubai - Men’s Final
programme.desc: The worlds top ranked Olympic champions competed for the titles of the last round ( Dubai ) of the World Triathlon Diamond League in an exciting atmosphere over long distances, including a 2000m swim, 80km cycling and 18km non-stop running. It is worth noting that the total prize money for this round was two million dollars.

programme.title: Qatar Club vs Al Shamal - Qatar Stars League 2025/26 - W6
programme.desc: The Qatari League is the official football league in Qatar. The league includes 12 teams. The most famous participating clubs are Al-Sadd, the champions of the last season; Al-Rayyan and Al-Arabi, the popular teams, Al-Duhail and Al-Gharafa, serious contenders for the title every season. The Qatari league includes star names such as Firmino, Verratti, and Qatari Akram Afif, the best player in Asia.
